name: Baked Salmon II
description: A classic marinade of garlic, olive oil, basil, and lemon that lets the salmon shine. Simple, healthy, and foolproof.
directions: In a medium glass bowl, mix together garlic, olive oil, basil, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and parsley to make the marinade.
Place salmon fillets in a medium glass baking dish and pour the marinade over them, making sure they are fully coated.
Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for about 1 hour, turning the fillets occasionally.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place each fillet on a piece of aluminum foil, spoon some marinade over the top, and seal the foil into a packet.
Place the foil packets in a baking dish and bake for 35 to 45 minutes, until the salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Carefully open the foil packets (watch out for steam), plate the salmon, and garnish with any extra parsley.
notes: Use wild-caught Alaskan salmon when you can find it — Costco carries it frozen and it's excellent. The foil packet method keeps the fish moist and almost impossible to overcook.

name: Vegan White Bean Chili
description: Creamy, smoky, and deeply satisfying. This one-pot chili gets its richness from coconut milk and miso, with a sweet potato base that makes it unforgettable.
directions: In a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat, heat the oil.
Add the onion, bell pepper, sweet potato, poblano chiles, and jalapeños. Season with salt and pepper. Cook partially covered, stirring occasionally, until softened — about 12 minutes.
Add the garlic, oregano, and cumin. Stir for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the diced tomatoes and beer. Cook stirring occasionally until the tomatoes are very soft and the alcohol has cooked off — about 10 minutes.
Add the butter beans and pinto beans along with all their liquid, plus 3/4 cup of water per 6 servings. Season with salt and pepper.
Reduce heat to medium and cook stirring occasionally until the liquid thickens slightly — about 15 minutes.
In a small bowl, whisk the miso paste with a little water until smooth. Add to the pot, then use a wooden spoon to crush some of the beans against the side of the pot to thicken the chili.
Add the corn and cook stirring until tender — about 4 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in the vegan cream cheese until fully combined and smooth. Taste and adjust salt and pepper.
Ladle into bowls and top with cilantro, radishes, and avocado. Serve with hot sauce and lime wedges on the side.
notes: This chili is even better the next day. Make it ahead and reheat gently. The miso is the secret weapon — it adds deep savory flavor. Leave out the jalapeños for kids or serve hot sauce on the side.

name: Sesame Tofu & Broccoli
description: Crispy baked tofu and roasted broccoli tossed in a sticky, savory sesame sauce. Serve over rice for a crowd-pleasing vegan dinner.
directions: Preheat oven to 425°F. Press the tofu by wrapping in a clean towel and setting something heavy on top for 15 minutes. Then cut into 1-inch cubes.
Toss the tofu cubes with vegetable oil and cornstarch until evenly coated. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet.
On a separate baking sheet, toss the broccoli florets with a drizzle of vegetable oil and a pinch of salt.
Bake both sheets at 425°F — tofu for 25 minutes until golden and crispy, broccoli for 20 minutes until edges are slightly charred.
While everything bakes, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, maple syrup, garlic, ginger, and sriracha in a bowl.
Add the crispy tofu and roasted broccoli to a large pan or wok over medium heat. Pour the sauce over everything and toss to coat.
Cook for 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens and clings to everything in a glossy, sticky coating.
Serve immediately over rice and top with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
notes: Don't crowd the baking sheets — use two sheets for each if making a large batch. Crowded pans steam instead of roast. Leave out sriracha for kids and serve it on the side.

name: Creamy Savory Rice
description: A comforting, creamy rice dish with silken tofu blended into a rich sauce, folded with cubed tofu and savory seasonings. Simple, filling, and surprisingly satisfying.
directions: In a pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add diced onion and sauté for 4-5 minutes until softened.
Add minced garlic and stir for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add arborio rice and stir for 1 minute to coat in the oil.
Pour in all 6.5 cups of broth, add salt and pepper, and bring to a boil.
Cover and reduce to a low simmer for 15 minutes. Do not stir during cooking.
While rice cooks, blend silken tofu with water or broth, nutritional yeast, and tahini until completely smooth.
Once rice is tender, turn off heat and stir in the cream blend, soy sauce, and paprika.
Fold in the extra-firm tofu cubes gently. Cover and rest for 5 minutes before serving.
notes: The silken tofu blends completely into the sauce — you won't taste it, it just adds creaminess and protein. Don't press the extra-firm tofu for this dish, the softer texture works well folded into the rice.

name: Beef Stew
description: A hearty, classic beef stew with tender chuck, root vegetables, and a rich savory broth. Simple and deeply satisfying.
directions: Cut beef chuck into 1.5-inch cubes, trimming any large fat chunks but leaving most of it. In a bowl, combine flour, sea salt, black pepper, onion powder, and Italian seasoning. Toss the beef cubes in the flour mixture until evenly coated.

Heat cooking oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy pot over medium-high heat. Brown the beef in batches — do not crowd the pan. Sear each batch for about 3-4 minutes per side until a deep brown crust forms. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
Reduce heat to medium. Add the diced onion to the same pot and cook for 4-5 minutes, scraping up the browned bits from the bottom.
Add the minced garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add the tomato paste and stir for 1 minute until it darkens slightly.
Add the balsamic vinegar and Worcestershire sauce, stirring to deglaze the pot and loosen any remaining browned bits.
Return the beef to the pot. Pour in the beef broth and add the bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a low simmer. Cover and cook for 1.5 hours.
Add the Yukon potatoes, sweet potato, and carrots. Stir to combine, cover, and simmer for another 45-60 minutes until the vegetables are tender and the beef is fork-tender.
Remove the bay leaf. Taste and adjust salt and pepper as needed. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.
notes: This stew is even better the next day — make it ahead if you can. The flour coating on the beef naturally thickens the broth as it cooks. If you want it thicker, mash a couple of the potato chunks against the side of the pot and stir them in.

name: Creamy Non-Dairy Mashed Potatoes
description: Rich, fluffy mashed potatoes made entirely dairy-free. Roasted garlic, soy milk, and vegan butter make these just as creamy and satisfying as the classic version.
directions: Wash and cut the yukon gold potatoes into evenly sized chunks so they cook at the same rate.

Place the potatoes and whole garlic cloves in a large pot. Cover with cold salted water. Bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes until the potatoes are completely tender when pierced with a fork.
Drain the potatoes and garlic and let them sit in the colander for 2-3 minutes to steam off excess moisture. This step keeps your mash fluffy instead of watery.
Return the potatoes and garlic to the pot. Mash with a potato masher or ricer until smooth. The garlic will mash right in and mellow beautifully.
Slowly mix in the warmed soy milk and olive oil or vegan butter, starting with half and adding more to reach your desired consistency. Warming the milk first keeps the potatoes from going gluey.
Stir in the nutritional yeast and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Taste and adjust seasoning. Garnish with chives and serve immediately.
notes: Warming the soy milk before adding is important — cold liquid makes mashed potatoes gluey. The nutritional yeast adds a subtle savory depth that makes these taste richer. Don't overwork the potatoes once the liquid goes in or they'll turn sticky.

name: Grilled Hamburgers
description: Classic grilled burgers with pepper jack cheese, fresh toppings, and all the good stuff. Simple, satisfying, and always a crowd pleaser.
directions: In a bowl, mix ground beef with worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix gently — overworking the meat makes tough burgers.
Divide into equal portions and form into patties slightly wider than your buns since they shrink on the grill. Press a small indent in the center of each patty with your thumb to prevent puffing up.
Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Oil the grates lightly to prevent sticking.
Grill patties for 3-4 minutes without moving them — let them develop a good crust before flipping.
Flip once and grill another 3-4 minutes for medium. In the last minute lay a slice of pepper jack on each patty and close the grill lid to melt.
Toast the buns cut-side down on the grill for about 1 minute until lightly golden.
Build your burger and serve immediately.
notes: 80/20 ground beef is the sweet spot — enough fat to stay juicy on the grill without being greasy. Don't press down on the patties while cooking, that squeezes out all the juices. Pepper jack melts fast so only needs about 60 seconds with the lid closed.

name: Vegan Tamales
description: A recipe featuring package corn husks (You will need about 50 - some will break and some will be too small), masa harina, refined coconut oil (melted) or any other neutral-flavored oil.

ingredients.name: package corn husks (You will need about 50 - some will break and some will be too small)
refined coconut oil (melted) or any other neutral-flavored oil
not chickn' broth (or any other vegan broth)
red chile sauce (You could use enchilada sauce if you can't get chile sauce)
filling of choice (see choices below. Choose 2 types - each one makes about 2 cups)

directions: Soak the corn husks
Place the corn husks in a large bowl and cover them completely with very warm water and place something heavy on top of them to keep them submerged. Soak for about 30 minutes until softened.
Mix the masa dough
Meanwhile, in the bowl of a large stand mixer, add 6 cups of masa, 1 tablespoon cumin, 2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon baking powder, and 1 teaspoon garlic powder then mix until combined.
Add the 3/4 cup of melted refined coconut oil, then beat on low speed until combined.

Then slowly add the vegan broth, and beat on low speed until combined. Once all of the broth has been added, increase speed to medium, and beat for 8 minutes until fluffy. Stop occasionally and scrape the sides of the bowl if needed.

Add 1 cup of New Mexico red chile sauce to the batter and beat again for 2 more minutes until it's well incorporated. (You can refrigerate your dough at this point if you are not ready to assemble the tamales.)
Prepare your fillings

Carne - Saute 1/2 an onion and 2 cloves of crushed garlic in 2 tablespoons of cooking oil until the onion is translucent. Then sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon oregano, and add 2 cups of vegan beef crumbles (sub jackfruit, pinto beans, vegan chicken, vegan ham, or vegan steak). Cook until the vegan meat is heated through, then add 1 cup of red chile sauce and 1 cup of vegan cheese.

Spinach - Warm 4 cloves of minced garlic in 2 tablespoons of cooking oil for about 5 minutes. Pour in 10 oz of baby spinach and sprinkle with a little salt, then cover with a lid. Stir every few minutes until wilted.

Corn and Bean - Saute 1/2 an onion in 2 tablespoons of oil until translucent. Add a can of black beans that have been drained and rinsed along with 1 cup of frozen corn and 2 teaspoons of cumin. (This is also good with 1/2 cup of green chile added.)
Green Chile Cheese - Mix 1 cup of New Mexican green chile sauce with 1 cup of vegan cheese.
Assemble the tamales

To assemble the tamales, place a soaked cornhusk flat on the countertop with the pointy side toward you. Take about 1/4 cup of the dough and spread it onto the top half of the cornhusk about 1/2 inch from the top making a square about 5 inches wide and a little less than 1/2 inch thick. (You can wet your fingers so that the dough won't stick and easily shape the dough with your hands.)
Place about 2 tablespoons of filling down the center of the dough.
Pick up both sides of the cornhusk and have the edges meet in the center over the top of the filling. Then tuck one side of the corn husk into the other and wrap it into a burrito shape.

Pick up the bottom of the corn husk and fold it up tight to the bottom of the tamale. Use a long skinny piece of cornhusk (or culinary string) to tie around the tamale and keep it from opening up during the steaming process.
Repeat this process until you have a steamer basket full of tamales.

Cover with a lid and steam the tamales for 35 minutes. Allow them to cool for about 10 minutes before eating. (They will be a little soft when they come out of the steamer, but firm up significantly as they cool.)
Serve topped with red chile sauce, green chile sauce, or salsa. Tamales are much better when served with a sauce. Red or green chile sauce is traditional and a mix of both is called "Christmas!"
notes: Don't make these alone. It's a lot of assembly. Have some friends or family help and set up an assembly line. Keep a bowl of water on the countertop next to you to dip your fingers in. The masa dough won't stick to wet fingers.

name: Chickpea Chowder
description: A recipe featuring onion diced, celery ribs diced, carrots chopped.

ingredients.name: apple cider vinegar or lemon juice

directions: In a large pot saute onions, celery, and carrots until a bit soft.
In a blender mix together the chickpeas, broth, aquafaba, and tomato paste.
Add the blender ingredients to the pot along with the spices, potato, and mushrooms. If you have extra chickpeas left over, add them too.
Let simmer for 15-20 minutes until the potatoes are soft.
Stir in the kale and vinegar and enjoy.
\* Tried and it needed more sweetness, more pb flavor, and more cooking time, so it has been adjusted to try again.

name: Baked Chickpea Chocolate Cereal
description: A recipe featuring can (15 oz) chickpeas, rinsed and drained, aquafaba, cocoa powder.

ingredients.name: can (15 oz) chickpeas, rinsed and drained

directions: Preheat your oven to 425 F.
Rinse and drain the chickpeas, and pat dry.
Spread the chickpeas out in a single layer on a baking pan (use one with edges so that the chickpeas don't roll off!), and bake for 10-15 minutes.
Mix the rest of the ingredients in a small bowl.
Remove chickpeas from the oven -
Toss the chickpeas in a bowl with the rest of the ingredients. It will be somewhat sticky.
Spread the chickpeas out in a single layer on a baking pan and bake for another 10-15 minutes, or until crunchy. They do crisp up more as they cool.
They should be crispy and crunchy! Let cool slightly and enjoy in a bowl with milk for a delicious and nutritious breakfast!

name: Gingerbread Loaf
description: A recipe featuring Ground Flax Seed (flax egg), Whole Wheat Flour (or mix of Gluten-Free 1:1 and Oat Flour), Baking Soda.

ingredients.name: Whole Wheat Flour (or mix of Gluten-Free 1:1 and Oat Flour)

directions: The Loaf\ Preheat oven to 350°F. Prepare a 9×5-inch loaf pan. Set aside. In a small bowl add your ground flax and 2 1/2 tbsp of water. Mix and let sit. You're making a flax egg!
In a medium bowl, whisk the flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, salt and pepper together until combined. Set aside.
In a separate bowl or dish, whisk the molasses and hot water together. Super easy, right?
Take that flax egg and pour it into a larger bowl and add the apple sauce and mix together. Add in the coconut sugar and vanilla and mix together until well combined.
Go back and forth between adding the dry mix and the water/molasses mix to the other wet ingredients until everything is mixed together. Don't overmix! It's going to be a thin batter - its okay!

Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for around 60 minutes or more until the gingerbread loaf is baked through. It's a moist loaf. All ovens are different and your loaf could take a little more or less time. To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the gingerbread loaf. If it comes out clean with only a couple moist (not wet) crumbs, it is done. Allow to cool completely in the pan set on a wire rack before removing from pan.
Orange Icing\ Whisk the confectioners' sugar and orange juice together. Drizzle over cooled loaf.

name: Chocolate Cream Cheese Cake
description: A recipe featuring flax egg (1 tbsp flax meal mixed with 3 tbsp water), ⁄4 cup oat flour \[120 g\], ⁄4 cup whole wheat flour (or buckwheat flour for gluten-free) \[120 g\].

ingredients.name: flax egg (1 tbsp flax meal mixed with 3 tbsp water)
⁄4 cup whole wheat flour (or buckwheat flour for gluten-free) \[120 g\]
⁄4 cup cacao or cocoa powder (27 g)
hot beverage (Korma date coffee, coffee, or tea) \[236 mL\]
⁄2 cup plant milk mixed with 1⁄2 tsp apple cider vinegar ("buttermilk")
white beans, drained and rinsed \[170 g\]

directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix the dry cake batter ingredients in a large bowl.
Add the flax egg, hot beverage, applesauce, date paste, plant buttermilk mixture, vanilla, and miso.
Mix the cream cheese filling except the chocolate chips until smooth in a high-speed blender. Move the filling to a bowl and fold in dark chocolate chips.
Add half of the cake batter to a 9-inch Bundt pan.
Layer on top with the cream cheese filling.
Add the remaining cake batter over top of the cream cheese filling.
Bake for 50-60 minutes.
Let the Bundt pan cool completely before removing it.
This cake should be served cold straight from the refrigerator.
Top with any WFPB icing of choice and fresh fruit.

name: Flax Wraps
description: A recipe featuring and 2 Tbsp ground flaxseeds, water, garlic powder.
directions: Wash all produce thoroughly.
Add all ingredients to a high-speed blender.
Pour the blended mixture through a nut milk bag or fine
mesh strainer into a bowl, pressing to extract as much
liquid as possible.
Pour the juice into a jar or bottle. Shake well before
serving.
Store in the refrigerator for up to 7 days.

name: Green Goddess Slaw
description: A recipe featuring green cabbage, thinly sliced, carrots, shredded, celery, thinly sliced.
directions: Cut the napa cabbage into quarters and remove the core. Chop into bite-
sized pieces. Dissolve the white miso paste in 4 cups of filtered water to
create a brine. Submerge the cabbage pieces in the brine and let sit for 4-6
hours, or until the leaves are pliable.
In a blender or food processor, combine minced ginger, garlic, apple cider
vinegar, and date paste. Blend until smooth.
For the spicy variation, add chili flakes and cayenne pepper to the paste. For
the mild variation, add paprika.
Drain the cabbage, reserving 1 cup of the brine. In a large bowl, mix the
cabbage, shredded carrots, green onions, and daikon radish with the
seasoning paste. Massage the paste into the vegetables using your hands
(wear gloves for the spicy version).
Tightly pack the kimchi mixture into a clean 64 oz glass jar, leaving about 1
inch of headspace.
Pour the reserved brine over the top if needed to ensure the vegetables are
fully submerged. Place a clean weight (like a small plate or fermentation
weight) on top to keep the kimchi submerged.
Loosely seal the jar with a lid to allow gas to escape, or use a fermentation
airlock. Leave the jar at room temperature (65-75°F) for 3-7 days, depending
on your preferred level of tanginess. Check daily to press the vegetables
down if needed.
Once fermented to your liking, seal the jar tightly and transfer it to the
refrigerator. The kimchi wil continue to develop flavor slowly and can be
stored for up to 1 month.

name: Vegan Chicken Nuggets
description: A recipe featuring cans (20 oz each) young green jackfruit in brine or in water, (see step 1 for prep), vegan chickenless broth or vegetable broth, nutritional yeast.

ingredients.name: cans (20 oz each) young green jackfruit in brine or in water, (see step 1 for prep)
vegan chickenless broth or vegetable broth

directions: Prep & marinate the jackfruit:

Drain the jackfruit and rinse well. Pat dry with a clean dish towel and try to get out as much water as possible. Cut the jackfruit into nugget-sized pieces. (Some cans of jackfruit come already chopped so you may not need to do this if your jackfruit pieces are a good size already).

In a medium bowl or sealable container, mix together the broth, nutritional yeast, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Add the jackfruit. Marinate for a minimum of 30 minutes, but overnight in the fridge is best.
Coat the jackfruit:

Separate the marinade from the jackfruit and pour the marinade into a separate bowl. Place the flour in another bowl. In a third bowl, mix the panko with the paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, and pepper.

Take a piece of jackfruit and coat it in the flour shaking off the excess. Dip it back into the marinade to wet the flour. Then finally dip it into the panko mixture, evenly coating it. Place the coated jackfruit on a prepared baking sheet or plate (see cooking options below). Repeat with all the jackfruit to coat. Spray the top of the coated jackfruit pieces with spray oil so that there are no dry spots.
Cook the nuggets (choose one option, I baked mine):
Oven method: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or lightly grease it.
Bake for 10 minutes, flip, spray with more oil to cover any dry spots, and bake for another 5--10 minutes, until they are evenly browned and crispy.
Air-fryer method: When you are ready to cook the jackfruit, preheat your air fryer to 370°F (188°C).

Air-fry the nuggets in a single layer for 8 minutes (working in batches if needed). Flip, spray with more oil to cover any dry spots, and air-fry for another 4--8 minutes, until they are evenly browned and crispy.

Frying method: In a large skillet, add about ½ inch of oil and heat. To test if the oil is hot, drop a small piece into the oil. If it bubbles the oil is ready to use. Working in batches, carefully drop the jackfruit nuggets into the oil in a single layer. Fry for a couple minutes per side until golden, then flip and fry for a couple minutes more on the other side. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
notes: Oil-free: for oil-free method, bake or air fry the nuggets, but omit the spray oil. They will still be tasty, just a little less golden.

name: Gingerbread Cookies
description: A recipe featuring Ground Flax, Coconut Sugar, Almond Flour.
directions: Make a flax egg by combining your ground flax with 2 1/2 tbsp of water and setting it aside.
Add everything except your flour to a stand mixer and turn it on and let it all blend up and cream together. Let it go until it's all a beautiful and uniformed dark brown.
Slowly add in your flour and scrape down the sides of your mixer as you do so. Keep going until you've used all of your flour (but not your Brown Rice flour! It's not part of the dough!
Once your dough is formed pack it into a ball and wrap it in plastic-wrap and chill it in your fridge for at least an hour or longer.
Preheat your oven to 350 F and prep your baking sheets with parchment or silicone sheets.

Sprinkle your work area with brown rice flour and roll out the dough until it's about 1/8-1/4 inch thick. Cut into whatever shapes you want and put them onto your baking sheets.\ Keep re-rolling your dough and cutting shapes until you run out!

Bake for 8-10 minutes, depending on how thin you rolled the dough, and let them rest for 2-3 minutes before removing from the pan to rest on a baking rack.\ Once cooled eat them as-is or decorate them with icing and candies of your choice!

name: Tofu Fried Chicken
description: A recipe featuring oz. Super Firm Tofu\*, Soy Sauce, Nutritional Yeast.
notes: \*I recommend using Super Firm Tofu, the kind that's vacuum packed. If you can only find Extra Firm, you'll need to press it for at least 30 minutes to get rid of the excess water. Sweet Potato Toast By: The Jaroudi Family Makes 4 Ingredients: For the Sweet Potato Toast: 2 large sweet potatoes (each cut into 2 long ¼-inch thick slices) For the Homemade Raspberry Jam: 2 cups fresh or frozen raspberries 3-4 Medjool dates, pitted (or 3 Tbsp date paste) 1/4 cup water 2 Tbsp chia seeds ½ tsp vanilla powder For Toppings: 2 large bananas, sliced 4 Tbsp nut or seed butter of choice (optional) Directions: 1\. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. 9. Preheat your oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Place the sweet potato slices on the baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway, until tender but firm enough to hold toppings. (Alternatively, toast each slice in a toaster on high for 2-3 rounds until cooked through and slightly crispy.) In a small saucepan over medium heat, add the raspberries, dates, and water. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally and mashing the raspberries with a fork. Once soft and combined, remove from heat and stir in the chia seeds and vanilla powder. Let sit for 5 minutes to thicken. If needed, blend for a smoother texture. Spread raspberry jam evenly over each sweet potato slice. Top with sliced banana and drizzle with nut or seed butter (if using). Zucchini Fries & Ranch Dressing By: The Jaroudi Family Ingredients: 2 large zucchinis, sliced into long fry shape 1⁄2 cup unsweetened plant-based milk 1 Tbsp ground flaxseed + 3 tablespoons water (flax egg) 3⁄4 cup breadcrumbs (or homemade oat crumbs) 1⁄4 cup nutritional yeast 1 tsp garlic powder 1 tsp onion powder 1 tsp smoked paprika 1 tsp Italian seasoning 1⁄4 tsp ground black pepper Whole Food Plant-Based Ranch: 1 cup raw cashews (or cooked white beans) 1/2 cup water 2 Tbsp lemon juice 2 Tbsp apple cider vinegar 2 cloves garlic, minced 2 tsp white miso paste 2 tsp dried dill 1 tsp onion powder 1 tsp dried parsley Directions: 1.) Set your oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. 2.) In a small bowl, mix the ground flaxseed with water and let it sit for 5 minutes until it thickens. 3.) In one bowl, pour the plant-based milk. In a separate bowl, combine the breadcrumbs (or oat crumbs), nutritional yeast, garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika, Italian seasoning, and black pepper. Stir to mix. 4.) Dip each zucchini fry into the plant milk. Then, coat it in the flax egg mixture. Finally, press it into the breadcrumb mixture, ensuring an even coating. 5.) Arrange the coated zucchini in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown and crispy. Whole Food Plant-Based Ranch**: In a high-speed blender, combine all the ingredients until smooth. Refrigerate the ranch until ready to serve. Paneer Curry By: The Jaroudi Family Serves 4 Ingredients: Tofu "Paneer": 1- 14oz block firm or extra-firm tofu, cut into cubes 2 tsp nutritional yeast 1 tsp lemon juice 2 tsp garlic powder 2 tsp onion powder 1 tsp turmeric 1 tsp smoked paprika Curry Sauce: 1 medium onion, finely chopped 3 cloves garlic, minced 1-inch piece ginger, grated 2 medium tomatoes, blended into a puree 1 - 15oz can chickpeas (drained and rinsed) 1 cup unsweetened plant-based milk 2 tsp cumin seeds 2 tsp coriander powder 2 tsp garam masala 1 tsp turmeric 1 tsp smoked paprika 1/2 tsp ground Ceylon cinnamon 1 tsp white miso paste 2 cups water or vegetable broth 2 cups fresh spinach or chopped kale 1/2 cup fresh parsley or cilantro, chopped (for garnish) Directions: 1\. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. 9. In a bowl, toss the cubed tofu with nutritional yeast, lemon juice, garlic powder, onion powder, turmeric, and smoked paprika. Spread on a parchment-lined baking sheet and bake at 250°F for 20 minutes, flipping halfway. Heat a dry pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and toast for about 30 seconds until fragrant. Add onion and sauté with a splash of water or broth until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and ginger, cooking for another 1-2 minutes. Pour in the pureed tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add coriander powder, garam masala, turmeric, smoked paprika, and cinnamon. Stir well. Stir in the chickpeas, plant-based milk, and water/vegetable broth. Simmer for 10 minutes until thickened. Mix in the white miso paste. Add fresh spinach or kale and cook for another 2 minutes until wilted. Gently fold the tofu into the curry. Garnish with fresh parsley or cilantro. Serve warm with a cooked whole-grain or whole-grain naan.

name: Vegetable Lo Mein
description: A recipe featuring low-sodium soy sauce, hoisin sauce, toasted sesame oil.

ingredients.name: whole-grain spaghetti (such as Barilla®) or lo mein noodles
large red bell pepper, cored and sliced
carrot, peeled and cut into matchsticks
small onion, peeled and sliced vertically

directions: 2. 3. 4. 5. In a food processor, blend the cooked butter beans, date sugar, tahini, vanilla, and miso until smooth and
creamy. Scrape down the sides as needed.
Add the oat flour and pulse until fully combined. If the mixture is too thick to blend, add 1-3
tablespoons of plant milk until you get a thick, dough-like consistency.
Press the mixture evenly into an 8x8-inch pan lined with parchment paper. Use a spatula to smooth the
surface.
Refrigerate for at least 2-3 hours or until firm.
Cut into 16 squares and enjoy!

name: Hearts of Palm Fish Sandwich
description: A recipe featuring vegan mayo, relish, lemon juice.

ingredients.name: , 14 oz. can whole hearts of palm, drained
TB [[Ener-G]{.underline}](https://www.ener-g.com/products/egg-replacer), whisked with ½ cup water in a medium-sized bowl until frothy
3 tablespoons vegan butter, for toasting the buns
mandolined cabbage (green or purple, or a mix)
mandolined red onion, soaked in ice cold water for at least 20 minutes, then patted dry
Cook Mode Prevent your screen from going dark

directions: To make the tartar sauce, combine all ingredients and set aside. With a flat palm, gently press down on each hearts of palm until it pops and flattens. Slide a piece of nori inside the split and repeat with the rest of the hearts of palm. In a medium-sized bowl, combine the cornmeal, flour, garlic and onion powder, paprika and salt and pepper. Place the panko crumbs in a separate, medium-sized bowl. Press the hearts of palm into the cornmeal mixture, then into the Ener-G mixture, then back into the cornmeal mixture, back into the Ener-G mixture, then finish with coating evenly in the panko crumbs. (You could also probably try the VeganEgg here as well.) Give it another press with a flat palm to flatten again. Spray liberally all over with the cooking spray. Place into an air fryer set at 400. Air fry for 5 minutes, flip, coat again with cooking spray, and air fry the other side for 5 minutes more or until golden all over. Be sure to use plenty of cooking spray to allow it to crisp up and get a golden color and crunch. You can alternatively bake in a pre-heated, 425-degree oven. Bake for 10 minutes, flip, spray again, then bake for 7-10 minutes more, or until golden all over. Be sure to use plenty of cooking spray to allow it to crisp up and get a golden color and crunch. To toast the buns, melt half of the vegan butter in a cast iron pan over medium heat. Place the bottom buns into the pan until golden, and repeat the steps with the top buns. Assemble the sandwiches with desired toppings with the tartar sauce, or as fish sticks with the tartar sauce.

name: Spinach Puffs
description: A recipe featuring sheet frozen puff pastry, thawed in the refrigerator, mayonnaise, (6 ounce) container crumbled feta cheese.

ingredients.name: sheet frozen puff pastry, thawed in the refrigerator
(10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (180 degrees C). Spray cups of a 24-cup mini muffin pan (or 2 12-cup mini muffin pans) with nonstick cooking spray.

Roll out the thawed but cold puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface into a rectangle using a rolling pin. Cut into 24 (approximately 2 1/2-inch) squares using a pizza cutter. Lightly press puff pastry squares into each cup of the prepared mini muffin pan and prick with the tines of a fork.
Mix the mayonnaise, feta cheese, Parmesan cheese, spinach, garlic, and pepper together in a bowl.
Spoon feta-spinach mixture evenly into the cups, being careful not to overflow the cups.
Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is puffed and the corners are golden brown, 15 to 16 minutes.
Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 5 minutes before transferring the bites to a serving dish.

name: French Toast Casserole
description: A recipe featuring (480 mls) canned coconut milk , light or regular full fat, (100 grams) sugar , any type - I like brown for extra flavor (Plus a little for sprinkling), x 12 oz (340 gram) pack silken or soft tofu , (different brands vary in weight slightly. As long as it's roughly the same that's fine)..

ingredients.name: (480 mls) canned coconut milk , light or regular full fat
(100 grams) sugar , any type - I like brown for extra flavor (Plus a little for sprinkling)
x 12 oz (340 gram) pack silken or soft tofu , (different brands vary in weight slightly. As long as it's roughly the same that's fine).
dairy-free butter , optional but recommended - omit to make the recipe oil-free
large loaf about (14 - 16 oz or 396-454 grams) stale crusty white bread , see my tip in the post if you only have fresh bread)
handful chopped pecans or walnuts , for sprinkling (optional)

directions: Add the coconut milk, sugar, silken/soft tofu (drained if packed in water), cornstarch, cinnamon, vanilla, salt, optional turmeric, and vegan butter to a blender. Blend until smooth.
Cut the loaf of bread into 1 inch cubes and place in an ovenproof casserole dish that holds at least 2 quarts/2 litres. It should measures about 8 x 12 inches or 9 x 13 inches.

Pour the "custard' all over the bread. Press down with a clean hand all over so the cubes suck up some custard then leave to soak for at least 30 minutes, or cover tightly and put in the fridge overnight.
Preheat oven to 350 °F (175 °). Scatter the French Toast Casserole with a generous handful of sugar and some chopped pecans or walnuts. (Omit for nut-free).
Bake uncovered for 35 to 40 minutes or until the top is golden and toasty. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.

name: Protein Bars

name: Apple Fritters
description: A recipe featuring whole wheat flour\*, unsweetened applesauce, large apples, peeled, cored, and diced very small.

ingredients.name: large apples, peeled, cored, and diced very small
(\*depending on how thin you'd like it)
You can swap a whole wheat flour for a gluten-free flour.
You may replace the almond meal and whole-wheat flour for another
option. This recipe works well with
oat flour, buckwheat flour, or spelt flour.

notes: You can swap a whole wheat flour for a gluten-free flour. Notes**: You may replace the almond meal and whole-wheat flour for another option. This recipe works well with oat flour, buckwheat flour, or spelt flour. Directions: 1\. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. Set your oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, Ceylon cinnamon, and nutmeg. In a separate bowl, mix the applesauce, date paste, vanilla powder, and plant milk until smooth. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Fold in the diced apple. Drop small balls of dough (about 3 tablespoons each) onto the prepared baking sheet using a spoon or cookie scoop. Leave space between them as they will expand slightly. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until the fritters are firm to the touch and lightly golden. Let them cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack. Mix the date paste, almond butter or tahini, plant milk, and vanilla powder until smooth and pourable in a small bowl. Add more plant milk if needed. Once the fritters have cooled slightly, drizzle or brush the glaze over the top. Let the glaze set for a few minutes before serving.

name: Snowball Cookies
description: A recipe featuring oat flour, almond flour, date paste.

ingredients.name: You want a fine date sugar to dust these cookies to represent the
World date sugar is PERFECT for this!)

notes: You want a fine date sugar to dust these cookies to represent the classic snowball cookie. (The Well Your World date sugar is PERFECT for this!) Directions: 1\. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. Preheat your oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. In a medium bowl, combine oat flour, almond flour, and vanilla. Mix well. In a separate small bowl, whisk together date paste, applesauce, and almond essence/extract (if using). Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until a soft dough forms. The dough should be firm but pliable. If too sticky, add a small amount of oat flour. Scoop about 2-3 tablespoons of dough and roll it into a ball. Place on the prepared baking sheet, leaving some space between each cookie. Repeat until all dough is used. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the cookies are set but not browned. Allow them to cool for 10 minutes on the baking sheet before handling. While the cookies are still slightly warm, roll them in the date sugar to coat evenly. Place them on a wire rack to cool completely. Roll a second time in date sugar for an extra snowy effect, if desired.

name: Ferrero Rocher
description: A recipe featuring whole hazelnuts, raw, hazelnut butter, date paste.
directions: 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. Mix hazelnut butter, date paste, and cacao powder in a bowl until well combined and slightly firm. Chill
in the fridge for 10-15 minutes to make the mixture easier to handle.
Take a small spoonful of the mixture and wrap it around one whole hazelnut to form a ball. Repeat for
all 12 hazelnuts. Place the balls on a parchment-lined tray and freeze for 40 minutes.
Melt the unsweetened dark chocolate in a double boiler or microwave. Stir in date paste and vanilla
powder until smooth.
Remove the hazelnut balls from the freezer. Dip each ball into the melted chocolate, ensuring it's fully
coated.
Roll each coated ball in the crushed hazelnuts (or oats) to form the final layer.
Place the coated balls back on the parchment-lined tray. Let them set in the fridge for at least 30 minutes
or until the chocolate hardens.

name: Banana Bread Whoopie Pies
description: A recipe featuring ripe bananas, mashed, oat flour\*, unsweetened applesauce.

ingredients.name: Notes: You can use any flour for this recipe.

directions: 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.
In a mixing bowl, combine mashed bananas, date paste, and applesauce.
In another bowl, mix oat flour, baking powder, baking soda, vanilla powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Gradually fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until well combined.
Scoop the batter (about 3 tablespoons per cookie) onto the prepared baking sheet, flatten, and leaving
space between each.
Bake for 12--15 minutes, or until firm and lightly golden. Cool completely before assembling.
Cream Filling: Blend all ingredients in a high-speed blender until smooth and creamy. Chill in the
refrigerator for at least 1 hour to thicken.
Once the banana bread cookies are cool, spread or pipe a generous layer of the white cream filling onto
the flat side of one cookie.
Top with another cookie, pressing gently to form a sandwich.
Repeat with the remaining cookies and filling

name: Chewy Chocolate Cookie
description: A recipe featuring oat flour, unsweetened plant milk, chopped dark chocolate.
directions: 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. Preheat your oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the oat flour, cacao powder, vanilla powder, and baking soda
until well combined.
In a separate bowl, mix the date paste, applesauce, and plant milk until smooth.
Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until a thick, sticky dough forms. If
using, fold in the chopped dark chocolate.
Scoop about 3 tablespoons of dough for each cookie and roll it into a ball. Flatten slightly and place
them on the prepared baking sheet, leaving some space between each cookie.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the cookies have puffed up slightly and appear set
but still soft in the center.
Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to
cool completely.

name: Hamantaschen
description: A recipe featuring whole wheat pastry flour, unsweetened applesauce, date paste.

ingredients.name: water (add more as needed for desired consistency)
Optional: Fine date sugar for sprinkling over finished cookies

directions: 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. In a small saucepan, combine the chopped figs, dates, water, lemon juice, and cinnamon. Cook over
medium heat until the fruit is soft, about 5-7 minutes. Blend the mixture into a smooth paste using an
immersion blender or a small food processor. Set aside to cool.
In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat pastry flour, vanilla powder, and baking powder.
In a separate bowl, whisk together applesauce, date paste, and plant milk.
Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing until a soft dough forms.
Wrap the dough in parchment paper and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Preheat your oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
8. 9. Roll out the chilled dough on a lightly floured surface to about 1/8-inch thickness.
Use a round cookie cutter or a glass to cut out 3-inch circles.
Place a small dollop of the date-fig jam filling in the center of each circle.
Pinch the edges of the dough to form a triangular shape, leaving the filling exposed in the center.
Arrange the cookies on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the edges are lightly golden.
Allow to cool completely on a wire rack before serving.

name: Mini Holiday Cheesecakes
description: A recipe featuring dates (softened if needed), raw almonds or walnuts, vanilla powder.

ingredients.name: Notes: You can swap the cashews in the filling for cooked white beans.

directions: Blend dates, nuts, and vanilla in a food processor until the mixture is sticky and holds together when
Line a 12-cup muffin tin with parchment liners or silicone molds.
Press about 2-3 tablespoons of the crust mixture into the bottom of each cup, packing it down firmly.
Place in the freezer to set.
Blend soaked cashews, silken tofu, date sugar, lemon juice, vanilla, and in a high-speed blender until
smooth and creamy.
Spoon the filling evenly into the muffin cups over the crust layer. Smooth the tops. Freeze for 1-2 hours
until firm if making this raw.
In a small saucepan over medium heat, cook until the fruit soften and release their juices. Mash lightly
or blend for a smoother topping.
Once the cheesecakes are set, spoon the fruit topping onto each one.
Raw: Serve chilled. Store leftovers in the freezer and let thaw slightly before serving.
Cooked: Cook the mini cheesecakes at 350°F for 15 minutes and let cool before removing from pan.

name: Cinnamon Roll Cookies
description: A recipe featuring oat flour, almond flour, unsweetened applesauce.
directions: 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. 8. Combine oat flour, almond flour, baking powder, vanilla powder, and cinnamon in a large mixing bowl.
Add applesauce, date paste, and plant based milk. Mix until a soft dough forms.
Cover the dough and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Mix date paste, cinnamon, and plant milk in a small bowl.
Preheat the oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Roll the dough between two sheets of parchment paper into a rectangle about 1/4 inch thick.
Spread the cinnamon filling evenly over the dough.
Roll the dough tightly into a log and refrigerate for another 15 minutes to firm up.
Slice the log into 12 equal pieces and place them cut-side down on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until lightly golden. Let them cool completely.
In a small bowl, whisk date sugar and plant-based milk until smooth. Adjust milk for desired thickness.
Drizzle the glaze over the cooled cookies. Allow the glaze to set before serving.

name: Birdseed Cookie
description: A recipe featuring rolled oats, raw sunflower seeds, chopped, raw pumpkin seeds, chopped.
directions: 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. 7. Set your oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper to prevent sticking.
In a large bowl, combine the rolled oats, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, sesame seeds, and ground
flaxseeds. Stir in the Ceylon cinnamon, vanilla, and nutmeg until the mixture is evenly blended.
In a separate bowl, mix the unsweetened applesauce, and mashed banana until smooth.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry mixture. Stir until all components are well incorporated. If you're
adding raisins or dried fruit, fold them in at this stage.
Scoop approximately 3 tablespoons of the mixture and shape it into a ball. Place it on the prepared
baking sheet and flatten it gently with your hand or the back of a spoon to achieve a flat, cookie-like
shape. Repeat this process to make 12 cookies.
Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 15 minutes, or until the cookies are golden
brown around the edges.
Once baked, remove the cookies from the oven and allow them to cool on the baking sheet for a few
minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Colorful Frosting
description: A recipe featuring cashews, softened\*, unsweetened plant milk, date sugar.

ingredients.name: Notes: You can use raw sunflower seeds if avoiding nuts

directions: 2. 3. 4. 5. Blend all the ingredients in a high-speed blender until smooth and creamy.
Pick your color. Add 2 tsp for a lighter color and 4 tsp for a deeper color.
Use immediately or refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
Use in a pastry bag with an icing tip.
Perfect for cookies, cupcakes, or cakes!

name: Classic Thanksgiving Dressing
description: A recipe featuring loaf whole-grain, day-old bread, cubed (about 8 cups), vegetable broth, large onion, finely diced.

ingredients.name: loaf whole-grain, day-old bread, cubed (about 8 cups)

directions: 2.) 3.) 4.) 5.) Preheat the oven to 350°F. Spread the bread cubes on a baking sheet in a single layer. Bake for about 10
minutes or until they're slightly toasted. Set aside to cool.
Add the onions, celery, carrots, and garlic to a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté, add a small water
splash to prevent sticking until the vegetables are tender.
In a small bowl, combine the white miso paste, poultry seasoning, black pepper, apple cider vinegar, and
a small amount of vegetable broth. Whisk until the miso is dissolved.
Add the bread cubes, sautéed vegetables, parsley, and miso mixture in a large bowl. Slowly pour the
remaining vegetable broth over the bread cubes, stirring gently until the bread absorbs the broth and the
mixture is moist but not soggy. Adjust the amount of broth if needed.
Transfer the mixture to your 9x13 casserole pan, spreading it evenly. Cover and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove cover and bake for 15-20 minutes, until the top is golden.

name: Baked Sweet Potato Slices
description: A recipe featuring medium sweet potatoes, thinly sliced, ground Ceylon cinnamon, vegetable broth.
directions: 2.) 3.) 4.) 5.) Preheat your oven to 375°F. Layer the sliced sweet potatoes evenly in the 9-inch baking dish,
overlapping slightly if needed. Sprinkle with Ceylon cinnamon.
In a small saucepan, whisk together the vegetable broth, plant milk, miso paste, nutritional yeast, garlic
powder, onion powder, black pepper, and cornstarch. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Pour the gravy sauce evenly over the sweet potato slices. Cover the baking dish and bake for 25-30
minutes or until the sweet potatoes are tender.
Blend the cashews, nutritional yeast, lemon zest, and garlic powder in a food processor.
Remove the cover over the sweet potatoes. Return to the oven, uncovered, and bake for 10 more
minutes.
Sprinkle the nut-based "cheese" topping and fresh parsley over the dish just before serving.

name: Whole Wheat Bread or Rolls
description: A recipe featuring warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C), sugar, active dry yeast.

ingredients.name: warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)

directions: Place water, sugar, and yeast into your stand mixer and mix for 10 seconds with the paddle attachment. Let sit for 5 minutes to bloom.
Add 2 cups of flour, oil, and salt, and mix on medium speed for 5 minutes until the batter begins to get stringy as the gluten develops.
Switch to the dough hook and mix in the remaining flour slowly until the dough releases from the edges of the bowl and does not stick to your hands.
Let rise until double around 30 minutes.
Shape into loaf pan, or rolls and let rise again around 25-30 minutes.
Bake at 325 for 30 minutes or
12-15 minutes for rolls. 3 loaves
4 cups warm water
¾ cup sugar
3 Tbs Yeast
¾ cup oil
2 Tbs salt
12 cups flour

name: Tofu Scramble

directions: Add all ingredients to a large skillet and cook until the vegetables are soft.
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Use with breakfast hash and beans for a filling breakfast burrito.

Sprinkle with a tiny bit of sea salt. Next drizzle 1 tablespoon of almond butter, 1 teaspoon of chia along with banana slices and finally a sprinkle of cinnamon in each sweet potato. Serve immediately.

name: Carrot Cake Oatmeal
description: A recipe featuring rolled oats, carrot shredded, water.
directions: In a large saucepan add your water, oats, carrot, vanilla and salt and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer, cover and cook about 5 minutes or until the oats have absorbed all the water.
Place in a bowl and top with walnuts, maple syrup and plant milk.
This is also good with a little shredded coconut on top or use coconut milk as the milk for extra flavor.

name: Servings: 12
description: A recipe featuring .

ingredients.name: **2 cups Whole wheat flour or any flour of choice; gluten-free flour can be used as well**
**½ cup Unsweetened apple sauce or 1 flax egg**
**½ cup Maple syrup or ¾ coconut sugar**

directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
Stir the dry ingredients, and combine the baking powder, soda, and salt with the flour.

Now add the apple sauce, orange juice, maple syrup, zest, vanilla, and cinnamon, and stir by hand, focusing on incorporating the flour mixture at the bowl's bottom. DO NOT OVER-STIR. Ensure all the dry and wet ingredients create a thick and lumpy batter.
Now, fold in the cranberries, making sure to fold gently to keep the berries intact.
Using a silicone bread pan or a pan lined with parchment paper, pour the bread batter into the pan, scraping down the bowl's sides to get all the batter.
Then, place some individual cranberries on top of the bread, randomly placing them. This adds more cranberry flavor and makes the bread pretty,
Cook for 50-55 minutes. If using a silicone bread pan, check the bread 45 minutes in, as silicone pans generally take less cooking time.
To check to ensure the bread is cooked, place a knife through the middle. It should come out clean. If there is batter on the blade, cook for 5 minutes.

name: Oatmeal Breakfast Cookies
description: A recipe featuring banana, mashed, rolled oats, cinnamon.
directions: Preheat the oven to 375°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Place all the ingredients in a large bowl and mix until fully combined. Add more oats if the mixture is too wet. Wet your hands and form into eight balls. Place at least 1 inch apart on the prepared pan. Flatten the balls with your hands or the back of a fork until they are approximately 1/2 inch thick.
Bake for 12 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into a cookie comes out clean. Recipe is one of four breakfast cookies from the PlantYou cookbook.

name: Shane's Banana Bread
description: A recipe featuring very ripe bananas (the riper, the better), maple syrup, unsweetened applesauce.

ingredients.name: very ripe bananas (the riper, the better)

directions: Preheat oven to 350˚F and line a loaf pan with parchment paper or use a nonstick loaf pan.

Place the bananas in a medium or large bowl and mash using a fork or potato masher. The bananas do not have to be completely smooth, it's ok to have some small chunks for texture. Now, add in all the remaining wet ingredients with the mashed bananas and mix until everything is well combined.

To a separate bowl add in all the dry ingredients and whisk them together. Then add to the wet and mix until everything is "just" combined. DO NOT OVERMIX. Think "pancake batter" consistency. A little thick with some lumps.

Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and bake for 45-50 minutes. The banana bread is done once you insert a knife or toothpick and it comes out clean. Keep in mind all appliances are different so cooking time can vary several minutes one way or the other.

Remove the banana bread from the oven and let it cool for a bit in the baking pan. Then, carefully remove it and allow it to cool, preferably to room temperature, on a cutting board or cooling rack. The longer you let it set the easier it will slice. The texture and flavor will get better as well.
Slice, serve, and enjoy!

name: Dreena's Banana Bread
description: A recipe featuring whole-wheat pastry flour or 1 cup 3-4 tbsp spelt flour for wheat-free version, oat flour, baking powder.

ingredients.name: whole-wheat pastry flour or 1 cup 3-4 tbsp spelt flour for wheat-free version
4 tbsp non-dairy mini or regular chocolate chips optional

directions: Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl, mix dry ingredients. In a separate bowl, combine pureed banana, maple syrup, milk and vanilla. Add wet mixture to dry, and add in chocolate chips (if using), and stir through until just well combined (don't overmix). Wipe a loaf pan lightly with oil (or use a silicone loaf pan). Pour batter into pan and bake for 43-48 minutes, until golden and a toothpick or skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Makes 1 quick bread.
notes: Gluten-Free Option: Replace all the flour with 2 full cups of certified gluten-free oat flour, or with 1 3/4 cups gluten-free flour blend (ex: Bob's Red Mill) plus 1/2 cup and 2 tablespoons almond meal and 3/4 teaspoon xanthan gum. Banana Note: Puree several medium-large overripe bananas in a blender or with an immersion blender and deep cup, then measure to get your 1 cup. Kitchen Tip: To make muffins instead of a quick bread, pour mixture into a 12--cup muffin pan fitted with cupcake liners. Bake for 17--20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Remove, let cool for a few minutes in pan, and then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely.

Topo with sliced bananas
Sprinkle with chia seeds on top

name: Oat Blender Waffles
description: A recipe featuring oats, flax seed meal, apple sauce.
directions: Blend all ingredients in a high speed blender until smooth, adding more milk as needed
Cook on waffle iron according to it's instructions

name: Nora's Waffles
description: A recipe featuring ground flaxseeds, water, soy milk.

ingredients.name: melted vegan butter or vegetable oil

directions: Preheat waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions.
Make the Flax Eggs: In a small bowl, combine the ground flax and water. Stir, and set aside to thicken.
Make the Vegan Buttermilk: In a large measuring cup or bowl, measure 3 1/2 cups of soy milk. Add the apple cider vinegar, stir a little with a spoon and set aside to curdle.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.

Add the flax eggs, vegan buttermilk, melted vegan butter/oil and vanilla to the dry ingredients. Stir until just combined with a large wooden spoon, being careful not to over mix. The batter should be fairly thick, if it's too runny add a few tablespoons more of flour. If it's too thick, add a little more water.
Spray waffle iron with non-stick spray. Pour the recommended amount of batter onto hot waffle iron, and cook until the waffle is golden brown on both sides.
Serve immediately, or keep in a warm oven (200 degrees F) until ready to serve. Top with fresh berries, coconut whip, vegan butter, maple syrup and anything else you desire!

name: French Toast
description: A recipe featuring soy milk, whole wheat flour, Flax meal.
directions: Heat griddle to 400 degrees
Blend all ingredients (except bread) in blender until incorporated
Pour batter into a 8x8 glass casserole dish and let sit for 10 minutes
Dip bread in batter quickly and cook on oiled griddle.
Flip when browned and can be flipped easily

name: Oatmeal Cold Cereal
description: A recipe featuring Old fashioned oats, Flax seed meal.
directions: Start with oats and flax seed in your bowl
Add whatever toppings you like
Top with cold soy milk, mix and enjoy
\*My favorite is topped with chopped dates, bananas, and blueberries. Dates and bananas are sweet enough and don't need added honey, or syrup.

name: Pumpkin French Toast Bake
description: A recipe featuring day old French bread, half of a big loaf (or even a few days old), light coconut milk, canned, pumpkin puree.

ingredients.name: day old French bread, half of a big loaf (or even a few days old)

directions: Cut bread into 1 inch cubes. I recommend you use day old (or even a few days old) crusty french bread loaf or sourdough loaf. You want something hearty and slightly dried out, do not use sandwich bread. Place in a 8×8 square baking pan.
In a large bowl, add the coconut milk, pumpkin puree, cornstarch, ground flaxseed, maple syrup, coconut sugar, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla, and sea salt. Whisk until well combined.
Pour mixture over the bread and use a spoon to toss the bread with the mixture so everything is evenly coated. Cover with saran wrap or foil and place in the fridge for at least 3 hours.

Remove from the fridge and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Remove saran wrap or foil and sprinkle the pecans and dried cranberries over the top. Bake for 35-40 minutes until the top is golden brown and set. Let it cool for 10 minutes before serving. Enjoy warm with maple syrup and some vegan yogurt or your favorite toppings!

name: Breakfast Hash
description: A recipe featuring 2 lb bag of Southern style frozen potato cubes, or 4 large potatoes, cubed, bell pepper roughly chopped, onion roughly chopped.

ingredients.name: 2 lb bag of Southern style frozen potato cubes, or 4 large potatoes, cubed

directions: Preheat oven to 500 degrees
Spread the potatoes on a lightly greased cooking tray and bake for 10 minutes
Add the chopped onions, bell pepper, and mushrooms and cook another 10 minutes, or until the potatoes are slightly browned
Remove from the oven and add the spices and spinach and toss all together to distribute the spices. Serve hot, or add to a breakfast burrito.

name: Nora's Simple Pancakes
description: A recipe featuring whole wheat flour, baking powder, salt.

ingredients.name: soy milk \*or use almond, oat or coconut milk
canola oil \*may omit for oil free

directions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.
Pour the milk, water and oil into the bowl with the dry ingredients, and stir with a large spoon until just combined. A few lumps are okay; do not over mix or your pancakes won't be as fluffy.

Heat a large griddle or pan over medium-high heat. Grease the pan with vegan butter or coconut oil, and drop about 1/3 cup of the batter onto it. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden brown on the other side, about 1-2 minutes. Repeat with all the remaining batter.
Serve with vegan butter, pure maple syrup and perhaps some fresh fruit.

name: Apple-Raspberry Crisp
description: A recipe featuring medium sweet apples, such as Gala or Fuji, chopped (48 ounces), frozen raspberries, thawed (4 cups), cus oat flour (see tip, above).

ingredients.name: medium sweet apples, such as Gala or Fuji, chopped (48 ounces)

directions: Preheat the oven to 425°F.

In a skillet over medium heat, cook chopped apples, stirring occasionally, until they begin to soften, 5 to 7 minutes. Add a bit of water if needed to keep apples from sticking. Transfer apples to an 11-inch square or 13x9-inch rectangular baking dish; top with raspberries.

In a bowl, combine oat flour, rolled oats, maple syrup, almond butter, baking powder, and salt; rub in with fingertips until mixture comes together in small clumps. Spread the crumble over the fruit. Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Serve warm.

name: Dreena's Pumpkin Muffins
description: A recipe featuring spelt flour, oat flour, rolled oats.

ingredients.name: 1/3 cup mini non-dairy chocolate chips optional... maybe!
flax meal or 1/2 tbsp ground white chia seed
pumpkin pie mix (see note) I use Farmer's Market Organic brand

directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients, sifting in the baking powder and baking soda. Stir until well mixed.
In another bowl, first combine the maple syrup with the flax meal, and then add the remaining wet ingredients and stir until well mixed.
Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture, and gently fold and mix until just combined (do not overmix).
Let sit for a minute while preparing a muffin pan with oil spray.

Spoon the mixture into a twelve-cup lined muffin pan (filling 12). Bake for 21-22 minutes, until set to the touch. Remove from the oven, let cool for a couple of minutes in the pan, and then transfer the muffins to cool on a cooling rack.

name: Everything Breakfast Loaf
description: A recipe featuring spelt flour, rolled oats, baking powder.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare a loaf pan by spraying/wiping with a touch of oil, and lining with a strip of parchment paper (for easy removal after cooling).
In a large bowl, add dry 12\`2\`ingredients: flour, cocoa powder, coconut sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Stir through until well combined.

Add zucchini, bananas, maple syrup and hemp seeds (if using) to a blender. Puree until smooth (this takes just a minute in a high speed blender, a regular blender will take longer). Once well pureed, add water and vanilla and blend again.
Add wet mixture to dry and stir through until just well combined, and add chocolate chips if using. Transfer mixture to loaf pan.
Bake for 50 minutes, or until set in the center (test with a toothpick if unsure). Remove and let cool in the pan on a cooling rack. Once cool, remove loaf and cut into slices.
notes: Flour Note: Measure the 2 cups of flour, and then remove about 3-4 tbsp from the amount. Muffin Swap: If you want to make into muffins, fill 12 muffin cups (lined with parchment liners) and bake for 25 minutes.

name: Homemade Muesli
description: A recipe featuring ( 90 g) raw almonds, ( 60 g) raw pistachio, ( 60 g) raw cashews.
directions: Mix all ingredients together and serve with berries, yogurt, or smoothie

name: Raw Granola
description: A recipe featuring rolled oats, pitted medjool dates\*, puffed quinoa\*.
directions: This one is super easy to make you are just going to put all the ingredients into a food processor and process until it starts to stick together. Place in a jar and keep in the fridge for up to a month. Use this to top smoothie bowls or with plant milk and fruit as a delicious filling breakfast.
notes: Notes If your dates are very dry make sure to soak them for 8 hours beforehand. Drain the water before using in the recipe. I get my puffed quinoa from [[nuts.com]{.underline}](http://nuts.com/) its a great addition to a lot of recipes but if you cant find it, you can sub puffed rice or even organic corn flakes.

name: Korean Pancakes with Scallions (Pajeon or Pa Jun)
description: A recipe featuring bunch scallions washed, with the ends trimmed and cut in half lengthwise if thick, all-purpose flour, cornstarch.

ingredients.name: bunch scallions washed, with the ends trimmed and cut in half lengthwise if thick

directions: Add the spinach, dates, and milk in a high speed blender and blend until smooth.
Add the rest of the ingredients, except the ice and Chocolate chips and blend again until smooth.
Taste and adjust the flavoring as needed, keeping in mind that the flavor will be diluted slightly once the ice is added.
Add the ice and blend again, until the shake is as thick as you'd like.
Add the chocolate chips and blend slightly to break up the chocolate just a bit.

name: Berry Crumb Muffins
description: A recipe featuring whole wheat flour, white sugar, vegan butter, melted.

ingredients.name: plant-based milk (such as soy or almond)
mixed berries (fresh or frozen and thawed\* see notes)
ingredients.cut: fresh or frozen and thawed\* see notes

directions: To a small mixing bowl add cacao powder (sift first to reduce clumps), maple syrup, ground cinnamon, salt, and vanilla and whisk to combine. Then add a little dairy-free milk at a time and whisk until a paste forms. Then add remaining dairy-free milk and whisk until smooth.

Add chia seeds and whisk once more to combine. Then cover and refrigerate overnight, or at least 3-5 hours (until it's achieved a pudding-like consistency). It may also be helpful to give the mixture an extra whisk/stir once it has been in the refrigerator for 30-45 minutes.

Leftovers keep covered in the fridge for 4-5 days, though best when fresh. Serve chilled with desired toppings, such as fruit, granola, or [[coconut whipped cream]{.underline}](https://minimalistbaker.com/how-to-make-coconut-whipped-cream/).

name: Soy Yogurt
description: Soy Yogurt.

ingredients.name: plain vegan yogurt of your choice

directions: Pour milk into your Instant Pot
Push the Yogurt button until it says BOIL
Wisk periodically as it warms
When the instant pot reads YOGURT setting remove the insert and let it cool to 110 degrees
Add the yogurt and whisk together
Return the insert to the instant pot and make sure it is on the YOGURT setting still
Put the lid on and make sure the vent is closed
Set to 12 hours
In the morning, you'll have yogurt! Stir before serving, since it does tend to separate. Your soy yogurt will keep for about 5 days in the fridge.
February 2025 Membership Recipes

name: Breakfast Broccoli Cakes
description: A recipe featuring cooked broccoli, finely chopped, -15oz can of chickpeas, drained and rinsed, frozen hash browns (thawed).

ingredients.name: 15oz can of chickpeas, drained and rinsed

directions: Boil Dangmyeon Noodles
Boil Noodles for 7 minutes, or as instructed on package.

Finely mince Onion (⅓ a whole) and Carrot (pinky-length piece) into small pieces. Dice 1-2 stalks of Green Onion into thin pieces as well. Then de-seed 1 chili pepper (or 1 jalapeno), and finely mince ⅓ of it into small pieces (this ingredient is optional). Place all of the veggies into a large mixing bowl.

Strain the noodles. Cool it down under cold water. Then shake off the excess water from the noodles. Place the boiled noodles into a separate mixing bowl. Use kitchen scissors to cut the noodles into small pieces - be thorough!
Add these chopped noodles into the bowl with the other veggies. Crack in 3 eggs.
Season the egg mixture
To the bowl, add-in Soy Sauce (¾ Tablespoon), Sesame Oil (¾ Tablespoon), Sugar (1 teaspoon!), Salt (1 teaspoon!)
Give it a thorough mix - make sure everything gets mixed evenly!
Make Egg Dumplings
Place some oil onto a non-stick frying pan. Place on medium-low heat. Once the oil gets hot, carefully scoop on two spoonfuls of the mixture and make small circular piles around the pan.

Let it cook for 20-30 seconds so the bottom can set. Then use a spoon in one hand, and a spatula in another to carefully fold the eggs. Then flip the dumpling so the other side can cook through as well.
Once it cooks through on both sides, place on a plate.
Serve with steamed rice

name: Carrot Dogs
description: A recipe featuring Carrots peeled, Soy Sauce low sodium, Apple Cider Vinegar Braggs.
directions: Cut and peel carrots to make them "bun length'.
UPDATED INSTANT POT INSTRUCTIONS:

Add cut carrots and marinade to Instant Pot. Attach and seal lid, then cook on MANUAL for 3-5 minutes. 3 minutes if grilling, 5 minutes if not grilling. After doing a Quick Release you can then leave the carrots in the pot until you are ready to grill (optional), allowing to marinate and add flavor.
I would marinate the carrots after the pressure has been released for at least 1 hour. If not grilling soon - remove carrots and marinade and transfer to a container you can store in the fridge.

name: Chickpea Salad Sandwiches
description: A recipe featuring (15-ounce) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained (1½ cups), tahini, Dijon or spicy brown mustard.

ingredients.name: (15-ounce) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained (1½ cups)
Healthy pinch each sea salt and black pepper

directions: Place the chickpeas in a mixing bowl and mash with a fork, leaving only a few beans whole.
Add tahini, mustard, maple syrup, red onion, celery, pickle, capers, salt and pepper, and sunflower seeds (if using) to mixing bowl. Mix to incorporate. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Toast bread if desired, and prepare any other desired sandwich toppings (such as lettuce, tomato, and onion).
Scoop a healthy amount of the chickpea mixture (about ½ cup) onto one slice of bread, add desired toppings and top with second slice of bread. Repeat for additional sandwiches.

name: Tomato Soup
description: A recipe featuring onion chopped, carrots chopped, celery ribs chopped.
directions: Cook pasta according to the package instructions, meanwhile...
Sauce:
Add the cashews, water, and all the remaining ingredients to a blender, and blend until smooth.

name: Macaroni and Cheeze
description: A recipe featuring pasta, raw cashews, water.

ingredients.name: > \*Usually I double the sauce recipe and put the extra in the fridge
> for later, but the original amount will be just enough for the

directions: It will be very watery.
Pour over the pasta and heat while stirring until the sauce thickens

name: TLT Sandwiches
description: A recipe featuring extra firm tofu, barbecue sauce.
directions: Preheat oven broiler
Slice tofu into slices and brush with barbecue sauce
Place on a lightly oiled baking sheet and brush the other side with barbecue sauce as well
Broil for 5 minutes and check to see if any are getting brown around the edges.
Rearrange the tofu if needed, in order to help them cook evenly and place back under the broiler
Continue this until some of the tofu slices are slightly browned around the edges
Remove from the broiler and set aside
Assemble your sandwiches with the tofu slices, lettuce, tomatoes, then whatever condiments you prefer such as vegan mayo, avocado, mustard, ketchup, pickles, onions, etc.

name: Potato Broccoli and Cheese
description: A recipe featuring large potatoes washed, fresh broccoli, cooked Kidney beans rinsed if canned.

ingredients.name: cooked Kidney beans rinsed if canned

directions: Steam the potatoes in the instant pot
Add 1 cup of water to your instant pot
Add the trivet to the bottom of the instant pot and arrange your washed potatoes on top
Cook on high pressure for 10 minutes (7 if potatoes are smaller)
Release the pressure and let the potatoes cool a bit while you ready the rest of the ingredients.
Meanwhile, make the cheese sauce
Blend all of the cheese sauce ingredient in a high speed blender and cook in a small saucepan, whisking constantly until thickened slightly.
Steam the broccoli in a large pot on the stove.
Warm the kidney beans in the microwave for 2 minutes
Top your potato with the broccoli and beans, then the cheese sauce and enjoy.
Also great with a bit of salsa, or guacamole.

name: Red Pepper Hummus Wrap
description: A recipe featuring .
directions: Slice all of the vegetables to fit nicely into the wrap
Slather a good bit of hummus down the center of the tortilla
Top with all of the other veggies
Wrap like a burrito and enjoy

name: Butternut Squash Soup
description: A recipe featuring large yellow onion, chopped, sea salt, (3-pound) butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed.

ingredients.name: (3-pound) butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed

directions: Heat a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, salt, and several grinds of fresh pepper and sauté until soft, 5 to 8 minutes.
Add the squash and cook until it begins to soften, stirring occasionally, for 8 to 10 minutes.
Add the garlic, sage, rosemary, and ginger. Stir and cook 30 seconds to 1 minute, until fragrant
Add 3 cups of the broth. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook until the squash is tender, 20 to 30 minutes.

Let cool slightly and pour the soup into a blender, working in batches if necessary, and blend until smooth. If your soup is too thick, add up to 1 cup more broth and blend. Season to taste and serve.

name: French onion soup
description: A recipe featuring Vegan Butter, yellow onions, sugar.
directions: Slice the onions very thinly (Mandaline)
In a large pot add the butter and heat on medium heat
Add the onions and saute for 5 minutes
Add the sugar, salt and pepper and saute, stirring periodically, until the onions are brown, adding a splash of water if they begin to stick too much to the pan
Add the flour and stir to cook for 1 minute
Add 2 cups of the broth and whisk everything together
Add the rest of the broth and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally
Serve with crusty french bread.

name: Fiesta Bean Salad
description: A recipe featuring can black beans, can pinto beans, can kidney beans.
directions: Add all of the salad ingredients into a large serving bowl and let rest
In a small bowl mix the ranch dressing and barbecue sauce
Toss into the salad enough dressing to lightly coat the lettuce
Serve with chips, or by itself for a hearty fresh lunch. Add rice and serve for dinner as well.

name: Beans on Toast
description: A recipe featuring slices whole wheat bread, family size can vegetarian baked beans.

ingredients.name: family size can vegetarian baked beans

directions: Lightly toast your bread either with a broiler, or toaster and spread out on a baking tray
Strain half of the liquid from the baked beans and warm them in a glass bowl in the microwave
Spread a nice layer of baked beans on each slice of toast and top with a bit of vegan cheese
Place the pan back in the oven, or broiler and let warm just until the cheese is melted

name: Holiday Winter Salad
description: A recipe featuring salad greens, small acorn squash peeled and cubed, sweet potato, peeled and cubed.

ingredients.name: small acorn squash peeled and cubed

directions: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Spread cubed squash, sweet potatoes and chickpeas on a baking sheet lined with
parchment paper. Roast for 15-30 minutes or until tender and slightly caramelized. Let cool.
In a bowl, whisk together the applesauce, tahini, white miso, date, balsamic vinegar, cinnamon,
and nutmeg. Add water, one tablespoon at a time, until you reach a creamy, pourable consistency.
Combine the salad greens, roasted squash, sweet potatoes, chickpeas, apple slices, pumpkin seeds, and
dried cranberries in a large serving bowl.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.

name: Veggie Pizza
description: A recipe featuring (8 ounce) packages refrigerated crescent rolls, sour cream, (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened.
directions: Add all the ingredients to a medium sized pot, except for the pasta. Make sure to use cooked lentils, instead of dry like we did in the video. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes.
In a separate pot, cook your pasta according to package directions, no salt, no oil!
Once it's done, mix both together and enjoy.
For added oomph, pour into a pan and bake in a 400°F oven for

name: The Best Vegan Meatloaf
description: A recipe featuring -2 tablespoons olive oil OR water for oil free, small onion, diced small, small carrots, diced small.

ingredients.name: 2 tablespoons olive oil OR water for oil free
\(2\) 15 oz cans chickpeas, drained and rinsed (3 cups)

directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees and lightly oil spray a 9 inch loaf pan.
Saute the onion, carrots, celery and garlic for 5 minutes, until the onions are translucent. Set aside.
Add the chickpeas to a large bowl, and mash with a potato masher or stand mixer. You do not want them to be completely pasty or mushy, but well broken up.
Mix in the cooked veggies and all the remaining ingredients to the chickpeas. I have found 1 cup of breadcrumbs to be enough, but if the mixture seems really moist, add an extra 1/2 cup.
Press the loaf mixture in the prepared pan, pushing down evenly with your hand. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
In a small bowl, stir together the ketchup and Worcestershire sauce for the topping.
After 30 minutes, remove the foil, spread the ketchup topping evenly on top of the loaf and bake for another 15 minutes, uncovered. Remove from the oven.
Allow to sit for at least 15 minutes before slicing if you can, it will hold up better. Sprinkle with fresh parsley if desired before serving.

name: Ramen
description: A recipe featuring water, oil (or more if desired), squares of extra firm tofu.

ingredients.name: Coconut amino or soy sauce (add as much or as little as you want)
Optional garnish: chopped green onions & sesame seeds

directions: Heat oil in a large pot
Cook tvp for a few minutes until a bit brown
Add spices and stir until fragrant
Add flour and cook flour for 1 minute
Add water, tomato sauce and sugar.
Bring to a simmer whisking the flour into the sauce
Reduce the heat to low
Rip the tortillas into 4 pieces and lay them in a layer on top of the sauce
With a large wooden spoon, push the tortilla layer down to the bottom of the pot.
Sprinkle a bit of cheese over the top
Repeat with another layer of tortillas, letting some of the tvp chunks get between the layers as you go.
Continue until you have 4 or 5 layers of tortillas and top with a bit of cheese
Put a lid on the pot and let simmer for 10 minutes.
My grandma Pearl always served this dish with a side of cottage cheese, refried beans, and a salad.

name: Nacho Salad or Tostadas
description: A recipe featuring medium bowl of refried beans p.123 or 2 large cans, chopped lettuce, chopped tomatoes.

ingredients.name: medium bowl of refried beans p.123 or 2 large cans

directions: Warm the beans over the stove, or in the microwave and serve alongside the tortilla chips, tostadas, and various toppings to choose from

name: Noodle Soup
description: A recipe featuring vegan butter, -2 onion chopped, ribs celery , diced.

ingredients.name: vegetable stock, or water with better than bouillon
freshly ground black pepper , to taste
batch homemade egg noodles , or 4 cups dry egg noodles

directions: Add butter, onions, diced celery and carrots to a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Saute for 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook for another 30 seconds.

Add vegetable stock and season the broth with rosemary, thyme, crushed red pepper, and salt (definitely TASTE the broth before adding more salt), and pepper. Taste and add a spoonful of "better than bullion" chicken or chicken bouillon cubes or granules as needed.
Bring broth to a boil. Add noodles (either uncooked homemade egg noodles, or dry store-bought pasta) and cook just until noodles are al dente.
